reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Increasing rural women participation in agriculture activities (year II)

description.narrative: Project justification: • Poor quality of agriculture inputs and weak technical capacities• Lack of sufficient expertise regarding diverse farming methods among farmers• Lack of access to agricultural land • Israeli settlers violence and practices t ake several forms, one of which is setting free wild pigs around Palestinian agricultural lands, wild pigs in turn ruin, eat and damage the crops of the village. The main objective:To enable rural women to have livelihood opportunities though supporting su stainable agriculture activities in Deir Ballout, in Area C mainly. Expected results:Women farmers are trained and their capacity is built in good farming and agricultural practices. 2 plots of agricultural lands are fenced, mulched and protected from wild pigs attacks that ruin and damage crops of the village. Right-holders/ beneficiaries:- Rural women - Deir Ballout community- Marginalised women farmer familiesDuty-bearers:- Palestinian Ministry of Agriculture- Local Governorate- Occupying power- ESDCImpl ementing partner:The Economic, Social and Development Center (ESDC). ESDC is a Palestinian development-oriented NGO with experiences in both the humanitarian and development cooperation in both the West Bank and Gaza. Within the development cooperation, ES DC is recognised for its work in developing and building the capacities of cooperatives and the cooperative sector. FCA and ESDC’s partnership started in March 2015 for a pilot agricultural project for 5 months. ESDC has proven to be a reliable and coope rative partner, aiming for high standards and great results.
